p: The irrigation and fertilization treatments had strong positive interactive effects on total biomass as well as chlorophyll content ( Table 1). Fertilization resulted in a 59 % increase in biomass among irrigated individuals (0.96–2.35 g), but only a 44 % increase among unirrigated individuals (0.61–1.1 g) ( Fig. 2C). Leaf chlorophyll content increased by only 9 % due to fertilization among irrigated plants (306–338 mg m −2), while fertilization of unirrigated plants yielded a 51 % increase in leaf chlorophyll content (122–249 mg m −2) ( Fig. 2B). Mean root:shoot of unirrigated populations (0.7) was significantly higher than that of irrigated populations (0.5) ( Fig. 2A).
